title: 108_hr1527
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Transportation Safety Board Reauthorization Act of 2003" and authorizes appropriations. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2003-2006 is specified, including amounts for each year and for the NTSB Academy. Additionally, funds for the Emergency Fund are authorized to not exceed $6,000,000. SEC. 3. ACCIDENT AND SAFETY DATA CLASSIFICATION AND PUBLICATION. Amends Section 1119 of title 49, United States Code, to include procedures for appealing determinations of aircraft accidents. Appeals can be made to the Board, with limitations in cases resulting in loss of life. SEC. 4. SECRETARY OF TRANSPORTATION'S RESPONSES TO SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS. Section 1135(d) of title 49, United States Code is amended to require the Secretary to submit an annual report to Congress and the Board on the regulatory status of safety recommendations. If the report is not received by March 1, the Board will notify relevant committees. The Board will notify relevant committees if the Secretary fails to submit an annual report on safety recommendations, including significant ones related to transportation safety. The subsection will expire after the report due on February 1, 2008, is filed. SEC. 5. ASSISTANCE TO FAMILIES OF PASSENGERS INVOLVED IN AIRCRAFT ACCIDENTS. The text chunk discusses the relinquishment of investigative priority in aircraft accidents by the National Transportation Safety Board, ensuring assistance to victims and families. Additionally, it mentions the revision of a Memorandum of Understanding within a year of the Act's enactment. The National Transportation Safety Board and the Federal Bureau of Investigation will revise their 1977 agreement on accident investigations within a year of the Act's enactment. The revised agreement will be submitted to relevant committees. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL AMENDMENTS. Section 1131(a)(2) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by moving subparagraphs (B) and (C) 4 ems to the left.
